definition: to rob/to plunder/to seize by force/to coerce/calamity/abbr. for kalpa 劫波[jie2 bo1]
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.chinese: 野蠻人把西部一座座城鎮洗劫一空。

sentences.english: After the thief broke in, there was almost nothing left in the room.
sentences.chinese: 小偷破門而入，屋裏幾乎被洗劫一空。

sentences.english: Many innocent blacks were slain and their homes sacked.
sentences.chinese: 許多無辜的黑人慘遭殺害，他們的家也被洗劫一空。

sentences.english: The Emerald Buddha was carried off with the spoils.
sentences.chinese: 翡翠玉佛和其他戰利品被洗劫一空。

sentences.english: The town has harried off with nothing.
A delightedband of Makah Indians seized what they could of the cargo and enslaved thesurvivors.
sentences.chinese: 一隊印第安人將船洗劫一空並把倖存者作爲了奴隸。

sentences.english: The British navy found their empty yacht last Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 上週四，英國海軍發現了這艘已被洗劫一空的遊艇。

sentences.english: Tom was sacked by a robber.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆被一個流浪漢洗劫一空。

sentences.english: The invaders gutted the historic building.
sentences.chinese: 侵略者們將那幢歷史上有名的建築洗劫一空。

sentences.english: You may worry about being robbed of your wealth.
sentences.chinese: 你會擔心你的財富會被洗劫一空。

sentences.english: Armed men led me into my ransacked house, guns slung over their shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 肩上掛着槍的武裝分子帶我進入洗劫一空的房子。
侵略者把城中的財物洗劫一空。

definition: to put to the torch (idiom)/to commit to the flames/to burn sth down deliberately
to burn down/to destroy with fire
to rake in (money)/to plunder/to milk people dry
to lose by theft/to have one's property stolen
to disappear without trace/to vanish all of a sudden/to spread fast/to spread like wildfire
to snatch (esp related to a robbery)
